content.description: Sit start right of “In a Big House Alone” and ascend the seam with a funky bit of climbing establishing on the face and hitting the finishing jugs. Topout from there.

An absolutely incredible compression boulder that would be sought after anywhere! Sit start and squeeze your way out using perfect holds on the arete, then perform a tough finishing move to a jug to topout.
content.location:
From the parking area, walk into the woods and trend skiers right of the small cliff. You will reach the boulder in about 30 seconds.

Coordinates are approximately:

39.111924° N, -79.495661° W

content.description: A bizarre climb requiring different styles of movement. Start stemmed out in an alcove left of “Cartoon Sized Hammer” and find a way to establish into the slabby face. Pull around the lip of a small roof and use some finger locking in a small crack to establish on the face above. Complete the highball topout using some comfy slopers. Weirdness.
content.location:
Begin left of “Cartoon Sized Hammer” stemmed out in the small alcove.

Coordinates:

39.111695° N, -79.494688° W

content.description: The smack down you weren’t ready for. This is an absolutely amazing line squeezing up the right side of the stand alone boulder located skier’s left/climber’s right of the small cliff. Slap your way up the wide squeeze and ride the arete along easier terrain for a highball topout. This is one of the best lines around- a must do!
content.location:
From the parking area, walk into the woods and trend left into the rhodos, where you will find this large and impressive boulder.

Coordinates:

39.111695° N, -79.494688° W

content.description: Begin with a sit start under the V5 crack/seam to the right of “In a Big House Alone”. Hit some slopers on the lip of the roof, and trend left, riding the arete on perfect pockets and crimps. Classic.
content.location: Begin right of “In A Big House Alone” but instead of following the seam above, trend left along the arete.
